title: Nigeria: Intel to Train 5 Million Women On Technology
text:
Nigeria: Hajj Tragedy - Amosun Commiserates With Deceased's Families 
Bent on bridging gender gap in technology, Intel Corporation has announced its plans to train five 5 million girls and women in the next five years through its 'She Will Connect' initiative. 
Already, its had started fulfilling its promise of having organised a digital literacy and entrepreneurship training for young girls and women in Lagos recently. 
The Director of Intel's Global Girls and Women Initiative, Suzzanne Fallender noted that the internet was powering ideas across the world but it was mostly harnessed by the male folks, a development which explains Intel's concentration in women. 
Commenting on the initiative, The Africa Program Manager for Intel Corporation, Suraj Shah said that the company intended to break down barriers, create interests and offer connections through technology 
"Intel remains committed to empowering young girls and women through technology. We are helping women understand that, there is a lot they can achieve with technology, and these are indeed amazing. 
‎"Intel is using the 'She Will Connect" to reach out to young girls and women in communities, States and countries around the world, offering an opportunity for Intel to encourage women to build connections, develop and solidify actions and also celebrate success stories to become the best version of themselves in their studies, work and careers."Shah added.
